docTitle.titlePart: Fragmentation of CDF jets: perturbative or non-perturbative?

byline.affiliation: Department of Physics, University of Florida,

front.div:
Presented are the most recent jet fragmentation results from CDF: inclusive distributions of charged particle
momenta and their k T in jets; average track multiplicities, as well as angular distributions of multiplicity flow,
for a wide range of jet energies with E T from 40 to 300 GeV. The results are compared with Monte-Carlo and,
when possible, analytical calculations performed in resummed perturbative QCD approximations (MLLA).
